notes: proper noun, city name; normally used without article
poetic or figurative use; indefinite article before proper noun
used sometimes (e.g., for the football club) or in specific contexts; city usually without article
rare; proper noun usually not plural
example_sentence_english: I see different Romes in history.

notes: partitive plural form; very rare before proper noun
example_sentence_english: I talk about the Romes of the past.

notes: contraction of di + la; used to mean 'of Rome'; often 'di Roma' preferred
example_sentence_italian: La storia della Roma antica Ã¨ affascinante.
example_sentence_english: The history of ancient Rome is fascinating.

notes: contraction of a + la; often 'a Roma' is used instead
example_sentence_italian: Mi riferisco alla Roma di una volta.
example_sentence_english: I refer to the Rome of former times.

notes: contraction of da + la; often 'da Roma' is used
contraction of in + la; often 'a/in Roma' without article
contraction of su + la; often 'su Roma' less common
example_sentence_italian: Leggo un articolo sulla Roma antica.
example_sentence_english: I read an article about ancient Rome.

notes: no contraction with la; used e.g. with the football club or team name
